sources.title: Man Of The West (1958) Gary Cooper Â· Julie London
sources.description: 1874: A former bank robber, now righteous, is forced by his former accomplices to participate in a new robbery. He pretends to submit to their violence, but in reality, he decides to kill the bandits.. One of the most acclaimed Westerns of the 1950s, it is above average in its presentation and design, but whose apparent morality and numerous harsh elements remain questionable..

metadata.Plot: On his way to hire a schoolteacher, a homesteader is left a hundred miles from anywhere when the train he is on is robbed. With him are an attractive dancehall girl and an untrustworthy gambler and he decides to get shelter nearby from outlaw relatives he used to run with. They don't trust him and he loathes them but they decide he can help them with one last bank job.
metadata.Actors: Gary Cooper, Julie London, Lee J. Cobb
